name: Test function
description: Test function to test if cli commands work

name: Enable/Disable ssh
description: Enable or Disable ssh

name: Enable/Disable camera
description: Enable or Disable camera hardware
If set to true, the system will make an effort to not divulge the user’s identity on screen or on the network.
name: Hide identity

description: Consider trash and temporary files old after this many days.
name: Old files age

description: If TRUE, anonymized reports will be sent automatically to the vendor.
name: Report technical problems

description: If the underlying hardware has privacy screen support and this setting is enabled, the panels supporting this technology will be obscured from lateral view.
name: Privacy screen

description: Whether volume can be set above 100%, using software amplification.
name: Allow volume above 100 percent

description: Recently used files will be remembered for this many days. If set to 0, recent files will not be remembered; if set to -1, they will be retained indefinitely.
name: Recent files max age

description: If FALSE, application usage will not be monitored and recorded.
name: Remember app usage

description: If FALSE, applications will not remember recently used files.
name: Remember recent files

description: If set to true, then Nautilus will automatically mount media such as user-visible hard disks and removable media on start-up and media insertion.
name: Automount disks and media

description: If set to true, then Nautilus will automatically open a folder when media is automounted. This only applies to media where no known x-content/* type was detected; for media where a known x-content type is detected, the user configurable action will be taken instead.
name: Automount open

description: If TRUE, automatically remove temporary files when they are older than “old-files-age” days.
name: Remove old temp files

description: If TRUE, automatically remove files from the trash when they are older than “old-files-age” days.
name: Remove old trash files

description: If FALSE, no anonymous installation or removal information will be sent to the vendor.
name: Send software usage stats

description: Whether the users full name is shown in the user menu or not.
name: Show full name in top bar

description: If the USBGuard service is present and this setting is enabled, USB devices will be protected as configured in the usb-protection-level setting.
name: USB Protection

description: If set to to 'true' the RDP backend will be initialized.
name: RPD backend

description: In order to be able to use RDP with TLS Security, both the private key file and the certificate file need to be provided to the RDP server.
name: TLS Certificate

description: In order to be able to use RDP with TLS Security, both the private key file and the certificate file need to be provided to the RDP server.
name: TLS Key

description: When view-only is true, remote RDP connections cannot manipulate input devices (e.g. mouse and keyboard).
name: RPD view only

description: If set to to 'true' the VNC backend will be initialized.
name: VNC backend

description: When view-only is true, remote VNC connections cannot manipulate input devices (e.g. mouse and keyboard).
name: VNC view only

description: If set to true, then Nautilus will never prompt nor autorun/autostart programs when a medium is inserted.
name: Autorun never

description: Whether the on-screen keyboard is turned on.
name: Screen keyboard enabled

description: Whether the screen magnifier is turned on.
name: Screen magnifier enabled

description: Whether the screen reader is turned on.
name: Screen reader enabled

description: Whether to use the high contrast style.
name: High contrast

description: Whether to beep when a key is rejected.
name: Beep sound on key reject

description: Ignore multiple presses of the same key within this many milliseconds.
name: Bouncekeys delay

description: Whether the “Bounce Keys” keyboard accessibility feature is turned on.
name: Bouncekeys enable

description: Duration of the timeout before disabling the keyboard accessibility.
name: Remove keyboard timeout

description: Enable accessibility keyboard shortcuts
name: Accesibilities shortcut

description: Whether to beep when a keyboard accessibility feature is enabled or disabled.
name: Feature state change beep

description: How many milliseconds it takes to go from 0 to maximum speed.
name: Mousekeys acceleration time

description: Whether the “Mouse Keys” accessibility feature is turned on.
name: Mousekeys enable

description: How many milliseconds to wait before mouse movement keys start to operate.
name: Mousekeys init delay

description: How many pixels per second to move at the maximum speed.
name: Mousekeys max speed

description: Whether to beep when a key is accepted.
name: Slowkeys beep accept

description: Whether to beep when a key is first pressed.
name: Slowkeys beep press

description: Whether to beep when a key is rejected.
name: Slowkeys beep reject

description: Do not accept a key as being pressed unless held for this many milliseconds.
name: Slowkeys delay

description: Whether the “Slow Keys” accessibility feature is turned on.
name: Slowkeys enable

description: Whether the sticky keys accessibility feature is turned on.
name: Stickykeys enable

description: Whether to beep when a modifier key is pressed.
name: Stickykeys modifier beep

description: Whether to disable sticky keys if two keys are pressed at the same time.
name: Stickykeys two key off

description: Whether to disable keyboard accessibility after a timeout, useful for shared machines.
name: Accesibilities timeout

description: Whether the “Toggle Keys” accessibility feature is turned on.
name: Togglekeys enable

description: Prevent running any URL or MIME type handler applications.
name: Remove application handlers

description: Prevent the user from accessing the terminal or specifying a command line to be executed. For example, this would disable access to the panel’s “Run Application” dialog.
name: Disable command line (experimental)

description: Prevent the user to lock his screen.
name: Disable lock screen

description: Prevent the user from logging out.
name: Disable log out

description: Prevent the user from modifying print settings. For example, this would disable access to all applications’ “Print Setup” dialogs.
name: Disable print setup

description: Prevent the user from printing. For example, this would disable access to all applications’ “Print” dialogs.
name: Disable printing

description: Prevent the user from saving files to disk. For example, this would disable access to all applications’ “Save as” dialogs.
name: Disable save to disk (experimental)

description: Disable the "Show Password" menu item in password entries.
name: Disable show password

description: Prevent the user from switching to another account while his session is active.
name: Disable user switching

description: Prevent users from writing or modifying files on removable storage devices (i.e. flash disks, mobile phones, cameras).
name: Mount removable storage devices as read only

description: Stop the user from modifying user accounts. By default, we allow adding and removing users, as well as changing other users settings.
name: Remove User administration

description: Whether to play sounds on user events.
name: Event sounds

description: Whether to play sounds on input events.
name: Input feedback sounds

description: The XDG sound theme to use for event sounds.
name: XDG sound theme name
